page.title: 10Trees in Sigglesthorne.
page.content: In recent times this area has lost a large number of{trees}and {hedges. The main causes of the loss of large trees in the area are the onset of{Dutch Elm disease,}which has resulted in the felling of at least twenty mature elms, and the felling of trees due to{old age.}Older residents of the village claim that up to twenty trees, estimated to be up to 300 years old have been felled in the last twenty years. There are plans to replace these trees but it will be a long time before they make the same contribution to the landscape which their predecessors have made. Many{hedges}have been lost when fields have been consolidated to produce large fields more suitable for cereal growing.
